Hi Wesley,
I've updated the demo so that now if you change one maze, the ot=
her also changes in the same way. I'm glad that you like it and feel free t=
o let me know if you have any more suggestions.
Joel

--- In neat@yahoogrou=
ps.com, Wesley Tansey <tansey@...> wrote:
>
> Ken (& group),
> 
> That demo=
 page is really cool. I love that you can change the maze layout on
> the f=
ly while everything is running. One note here is that changing one
> side's=
 maze should probably change the other side's maze as well.

> Wesley

=
> On Mon, Jul 19, 2010 at 12:32 PM, Ken <kstanley@...> wrote:
> 
> >
> >
> =
> To consolidate information on the subject and help those interested in
> =
> exploring the idea, we are pleased to introduce the new Novelty Search Us=
ers
> > Page:
> >
> > http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/noveltysearch/userspage/
> >
=
> > The page provides introductory information, links to publications from
=
> > EPlex and from others, links to software, and answers frequently asked
=
> > questions. It also links to a nice online visual demo at
> > http://epl=
ex.cs.ucf.edu/noveltysearch/userspage/demo.html
> > that gives an intuitive=
 feel for how populations behave under novelty
> > search.
> >
> > The page=
 is also now linked from the main menu of the EPlex website and
> > from my=
 own homepage. We are happy to take further suggestions and to add
> > link=
s to other publications on the subject of which we may not be aware.
